data.title: August 2024: Things to do in Greenville, Spartanburg and beyond!
data.meta_description: Your guide to August’s family friendly events
data.text:
Things to do with your kids in Greenville, Spartanburg and the Upstate – find plenty to do from babies to teens. Look for weekly updates and highlights and even more events at upstateparent.com.

Send your organization’s family events to chris@worthyplace.com.

Sign up now:

Paris Mountain State Park’s School Program Volunteer Orientation is 9 a.m. – 2 p.m. Aug. 21. Adults of all ages who want to share their enthusiasm for the natural world with grades 2 – 5, must enjoy working with school children, and appreciate the chance to get exercise from lots of walking – your help is needed. Participants should dress for the weather and bring a bag lunch. Registration is required. For registration and information, email Ranger Cathy Taylor at ctaylor@scprt.com or call 864-244-5565.

Ongoing events and exhibitions

“Finding the Force…Awakening an Empire,”a Star Wars exhibition, is open at the Upcountry History Museum through Nov. 3. The exhibition brings together a unique presentation of the history, the costuming, the creatives, and the characters, highlighting the legends and legacies of this storied franchise, and providing insight into the elements that have consistently connected us to a galaxy far, far away for over 45 years. For details, visit upcountryhistory.org.

Curious George: Let’s Get Curious! is open at the Upcountry History Museum. The exhibition is a hands-on, bilingual (English and Spanish), interactive learning experience, developed for children ages 2 – 8 and their caregivers. It continues through Oct. 6. For details, visit upcountryhistory.org.

Play Dates for all ages continue every day this summer at TR Makers Co. Register for the Play Date of your choice at trmakersco.org/play/book-a-play-date/.

Wings in the Air is open at TCMU-Greenville. Soar to new heights and explore the cultural corner, where guests will embark on an adventurous journey to Colombia. Visit tcmupstate.org.

Lil Boogers LaZoom's Kids' Comedy Bus Tour runs at noon Sundays – Fridays and at 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. on Saturdays through Aug. 31 in Asheville. Ride the big purple bus for the educational and entertaining LaZoom’s Kids’ Comedy Tour. It features a blend of Asheville’s history and kid-centric comedy. Learn about the city’s past and see the sights with outlandish tour guides, hilarious comedy skits and all sorts of special appearances. Tours are one hour and geared towards ages 5 – 12 but with jokes written for kids of all ages. The cost is $27 each. Learn more at lazoomtours.com/lil-boogers.

August Events

Thursday, Aug. 1

Panthers Fan Fest is at Clemson’s Memorial Stadium. Tickets are $5 each. All ticket proceeds will benefit Carolina Panthers Charities and its ongoing mission to serve communities across the Carolinas. For details, visit panthers.com/training-camp.

Neighborhood Night is 5:30– 8:30 p.m. at the Upcountry History Museum. Drop in to explore the museum and its changing exhibitions. No registration is required. Admission is free. Call 864-467-3100, email info@upcountryhistory.org or visit upcountryhistory.org.

Cirque du Soleil’s “Corteo” is at Bojangles Coliseum in Charlotte. For tickets and details, visit boplex.com/events/cirque-du-soleil.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Furman University’s Lakeside Concert is at 7:30 p.m. Admission is free. Visit furman.edu/academics/music/camps-conferences/music-by-the-lake.

Friday, Aug. 2

A Creek Ranger Hike is 10 a.m. – noon at Paris Mountain State Park. All ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. Register and pay online. For details and registration, visit southcarolinaparks.com/products/10003610.

Books and Bubbles is at 3 p.m. at The Bunny Hive in Greenville. The class is free. For details, and registration, visit thebunnyhive.com/greenville.

Countdown to Kindergarten is 5 – 7 p.m. on Magnolia Street in front of TCMU-Spartanburg. The event is free for families with children in rising grades K3 - K5, but registration is required. Get details and RSVP at tcmupstate.org/spartanburg/countdowntokindergarten.

Laser Days of Summer: Taylor Swift is at Roper Mountain Science Center. Music like Tom Petty, Taylor Swift, Journey, Pink Floyd, Bowie, the Doors, Elton John, The Rolling Stones, Beatles, Metallica, Queen and much more will be showcased. For details and tickets, visit ropermountain.org/public.asp?titleid=lasersummer.

Cirque du Soleil’s “Corteo” is at Bojangles Coliseum in Charlotte. For tickets and details, visit boplex.com/events/cirque-du-soleil.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Saturday, Aug. 3

The TD Saturday Market is 8 a.m. – noon in downtown Greenville. For vendors, children’s events and more, visit saturdaymarketlive.com.

The Village Launch Market is 10 a.m. – 2 p.m. in West Greenville on Burdette Street and Pendleton Street. For details, visit villagelaunch.org/village-launch-market.

Cirque du Soleil’s “Corteo” is at Bojangles Coliseum in Charlotte. For tickets and details, visit boplex.com/events/cirque-du-soleil.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Sunday, Aug. 4

The Greenville Drive plays at 3:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. Kids run the bases after the game. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Cirque du Soleil’s “Corteo” is at Bojangles Coliseum in Charlotte. For tickets and details, visit boplex.com/events/cirque-du-soleil.

Monday, Aug. 5

TCMU is open today. Both TCMU locations – Greenville and Spartanburg – are open from 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. Visit tcmupstate.org.

Bilingual story time in Russian is at 10:30 a.m. at the Boiling Springs Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Teen Recharge is at 3 p.m. at the Inman Library. Choose between games on an Oculus VR, board games, crafts, or simply chat and recharge yourself (or your phone). Stay until the end and you could win a prize. For teens ages 12-18 or in grades 7-12. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Tuesday, Aug. 6

$1 Summer movies – “Minions: The Rise of Gru” and “Sing 2” are shown at 11 a.m. at select Regal theaters. See details at regmovies.com/static/en/us/smx.

A Plant Swap is at the Greer Farmers Market from 4:30 – 7:30 p.m. at Greer City Park. Visit greerfarmersmarket.com.

Celebrate National Night Out 2024 with the Mauldin Police Department from 5 – 9 p.m. at the Mauldin Cultural Center outdoor amphitheater. The annual event will feature free food and beverages, music and family-friendly activities. Special guests will include the Greenville Swamp Rabbits, Greenville Triumph and The Blood Connection. Meet local law enforcement officers in a casual setting and enjoy fun for the whole family, including a petting zoo, face painting, bounce houses, balloon art and a chalk zone. There will also be police vehicles and fire trucks on site, a K-9 demonstration, and DUI and fire education, along with live music. View the Facebook event at facebook.com/events/874271754522540.

Wednesday, Aug. 7

Baby Story Time is at 10 a.m. at the Spartanburg Main Library. Ages birth – 18 months. Space is limited. Ask for tickets at the Children's Room entrance starting at 9:30 a.m. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

$1 Summer movies – “Minions: The Rise of Gru” and “Sing 2” are shown at 11 a.m. at select Regal theaters. See details at regmovies.com/static/en/us/smx.

Thursday, Aug. 8

Preschool Story Time is at 11 a.m. at the Spartanburg Main Library. Ages 3 – 5. Space is limited. Ask for tickets at the Children's Room entrance starting at 10:25 a.m. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

The Really Good, Really Big, Really Cheap Book Sale, benefitting Greenville Literacy Association, opens with a kickoff party at McAlister Square. For tickets, visit greenvilleliteracy.org/upcoming-events/book-sale.

Friday, Aug. 9

A Park Hop Play Date is 10 a.m. – noon at Kids Planet in Greer. Visit parkhop.org.

Switch-A-Roos Children’s Consignment Sale is at the Greenville Convention Center. For details, visit switcharoosconsignment.com/greenville.

Books and Bubbles is at 3 p.m. at The Bunny Hive in Greenville. The class is free. For details, and registration, visit thebunnyhive.com/greenville.

Movies at the Mill, a free family-friendly event with food trucks, outdoor games, popcorn, and more, is at Judson Mill. Movies start at dusk. For details, visit facebook.com/judsonmilldistrict.

Saturday, Aug. 10

The Really Good, Really Big, Really Cheap Book Sale, benefitting Greenville Literacy Association, is at McAlister Square. For details, visit greenvilleliteracy.org/upcoming-events/book-sale.

Switch-A-Roos Children’s Consignment Sale is at the Greenville Convention Center. For details, visit switcharoosconsignment.com/greenville.

The TD Saturday Market is 8 a.m. – noon in downtown Greenville. For vendors, children’s events and more, visit saturdaymarketlive.com.

Toddler Time with Curious George is at 10 a.m. at the Upcountry History Museum. Register online. For details, visit upcountryhistory.org.

Saturday Story Time is at 10:30 a.m. at the Cyrill-Westside Library. Best suited for ages 5 and younger. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Sunday, Aug. 11

The Really Good, Really Big, Really Cheap Book Sale, benefitting Greenville Literacy Association, is at McAlister Square. For details, visit greenvilleliteracy.org/upcoming-events/book-sale.

Switch-A-Roos Children’s Consignment Sale is at the Greenville Convention Center. For details, visit switcharoosconsignment.com/greenville.

Monday, Aug. 12

Tuesday, Aug. 13

Mini Makers: Enchanted Forest is 9 – 10 a.m. at TR Makers Co. Explore castles, dragons, unicorns, fairies and gnomes. Ages 2 – 5. For details and registration visit trmakersco.org/product/mm-su24-k5.

Story Time Playdate is at 10 a.m. at the Berea Library. Ages 5 and younger. For details, visit greenvillelibrary.org.

Bilingual story time in Russian is at 11 a.m. at the Inman Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Preschool Story Time is at 11 a.m. at the Spartanburg Main Library. Ages 3 – 5. Space is limited. Ask for tickets at the Children's Room entrance starting at 10:25 a.m. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Engage with Community Resources at the Greer Farmers Market from 4:30 – 7:30 p.m. at Greer City Park. Visit greerfarmersmarket.com.

Wednesday, Aug. 14

Baby Story Time is at 10 a.m. at the Spartanburg Main Library. Ages birth – 18 months. Space is limited. Ask for tickets at the Children's Room entrance starting at 9:30 a.m. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Hora del Cuento en Español is at 10 a.m. at the Cyrill-Westside Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Thursday, Aug. 15

Teens Taste Test Potato Chips at 4:30 p.m. at the Inman Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Friday, Aug. 16

Books and Bubbles is at 3 p.m. at The Bunny Hive in Greenville. The class is free. For details, and registration, visit thebunnyhive.com/greenville.

Salsa at Sunset is at 7 p.m. at Camperdown Plaza. Join Upstate International and BDV Solutions for an evening of music and dancing celebrating Latin music and culture. This is a free, family-friendly event. Learn how to salsa from Pura Alegría Dance instructors starting at 6:15 p.m. For details, visit upstateinternational.org/ui-event-category/salsa-at-sunset.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Date night alert – Legends Concert Series: Elvis tribute band performs at South Carolina Children's Theatre. For tickets and details, visit legendsconcertseries.com.

Saturday, Aug. 17

A Foreign Object Debris Walk is 6 – 8:30 a.m. at the Greenville Downtown Airport. This is one of two times each year that visitors can walk on the runway at the airport. For event details, visit facebook.com/share/gPbvyqgN63nNENEy.

The TD Saturday Market is 8 a.m. – noon in downtown Greenville. For vendors, children’s events and more, visit saturdaymarketlive.com.

Mini Makers: Enchanted Forest is 9 – 10 a.m. at TR Makers Co. Explore castles, dragons, unicorns, fairies and gnomes. Ages 2 – 5. For details and registration visit trmakersco.org/product/mm-su24-k5.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Sunday, Aug. 18

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 3 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

“Avatar: The Last Airbender in Concert” is at 7 p.m. at the Peace Center. For tickets and details, visit peacecenter.org.

Monday, Aug. 19

Tuesday, Aug. 20

Toddler Time with Curious George is at 10 a.m. at the Upcountry History Museum. Register online. For details, visit upcountryhistory.org.

Celebrate Clean Water Appreciation Day at the Greer Farmers Market from 4:30 – 7:30 p.m. at Greer City Park. Visit greerfarmersmarket.com.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Wednesday, Aug. 21

Baby Story Time is at 10 a.m. at the Spartanburg Main Library. Ages birth – 18 months. Space is limited. Ask for tickets at the Children's Room entrance starting at 9:30 a.m. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Playdough Playdate is at 10:30 a.m. at the Hughes Main Library. Ages 2 – 6. Email child@greenvillelibrary.org if your child requires a gluten-free playdough alternative. For details, visit greenvillelibrary.org.

Teen LEGO Challenge is at 4 p.m. at the Boiling Springs Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Thursday, Aug. 22

Teen Art Club: Custom Sketchbooking is at 4 p.m. at the Boiling Springs Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Camp TCMU – Adult Night at TCMU is 7 – 10 p.m. at TCMU-Greenville. This is a fundraising event and for ages 21 and older. The summer camp theme encourages guests to revisit their fond memories and create new experiences with a night of food, drinks, activities and museum exploration. Ticket purchases include (3) drink tickets (beer or wine), camp-inspired bites, friendship bracelets, campfire stories and games, Plus-Plus campfire creations, jam tasting with Skytop Orchard, beer tasting with Thomas Creek Brewery, a raffle and museum exploration Individual tickets are $75 and couple tickets (admit 2) are $135. TCMU Members receive a 10 percent discount on individual ticket purchases. As this is a fundraiser for the museum, tickets are nonrefundable. For details and tickets, visit tcmupstate.org/greenville/adult-night-2024.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Friday, Aug. 23

Books and Bubbles is at 3 p.m. at The Bunny Hive in Greenville. The class is free. For details, and registration, visit thebunnyhive.com/greenville.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Saturday, Aug. 24

The TD Saturday Market is 8 a.m. – noon in downtown Greenville. For vendors, children’s events and more, visit saturdaymarketlive.com.

A Park Hop Play Date is 10 a.m. – noon at Unity Park. Visit parkhop.org.

Saturday Story Time is at 10:30 a.m. at the Cyrill-Westside Library. Best suited for ages 5 and younger. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

The Greenville Drive plays at 7:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Sunday, Aug. 25

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 3 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

The Greenville Drive plays at 3:05 p.m. at Fluor Field. Kids run the bases after the game. For tickets, visit milb.com/greenville.

Monday, Aug. 26

Teen Recharge is at 4:30 p.m. at the Inman Library. Choose between games on a Nintendo Switch, board games, crafts, or simply chat and recharge yourself (or your phone). Stay until the end and you could win a prize. For teens ages 12-18 or in grades 7-12. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Tuesday, Aug. 27

Mini Makers: Zoo Quest is 9 – 10 a.m. at TR Makers Co. Find out more about zoo animals and their habitats. Ages 2 – 5. For details and registration visit trmakersco.org/product/mm-su24-k5.

Preschool Story Time for ages 3 – 5 is at 10:30 a.m. at the Boiling Springs Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Teens Play: Spy School Escape Room is at 4 p.m. at the Chesnee Library. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

An Apple Celebration is at the Greer Farmers Market from 4:30 – 7:30 p.m. at Greer City Park. Visit greerfarmersmarket.com.

Wednesday, Aug. 28

Baby Story Time is at 10 a.m. at the Spartanburg Main Library. Ages birth – 18 months. Space is limited. Ask for tickets at the Children's Room entrance starting at 9:30 a.m. For details, visit spartanburglibraries.org.

Thursday, Aug. 29

Family Craft Night: Mystery Craft is 5 – 7 p.m. (drop in) at the Five Forks Library. Visit greenvillelibrary.org.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Friday, Aug. 30

Books and Bubbles is at 3 p.m. at The Bunny Hive in Greenville. The class is free. For details, and registration, visit thebunnyhive.com/greenville.

Mauldin Theatre Company presents “A Chorus Line” at 7:30 p.m. at Mauldin Cultural Center. For more information and tickets, visit mauldinculutralcenter.org.

Saturday, Aug. 31

The TD Saturday Market is 8 a.m. – noon in downtown Greenville. For vendors, children’s events and more, visit saturdaymarketlive.com.

Family Fun Day with the Greenville Zoo is 10 a.m. – noon at the Upcountry History Museum. For details, visit upcountryhistory.org.
